title: Work-Based Learning Strategy Development Through MOOC Design Process Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of MOOCs and online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Operated in an asynchronous online environment promoting collaboration and reflective practice among learners. Strengthening work-based learning experiences by analyzing actual MOOC development cases.

learning_goals: Students can explain core elements of the five-stage MOOC design process: needs analysis, instructional design, production, implementation, and evaluation.
Students can identify at least three systemic conflict factors arising during MOOC development based on work-based learning theory.
Students can analyze techno-pedagogical constraints when using the edX platform and propose improvement strategies.
Students can specify organizational structure improvement strategies to enhance interdisciplinary collaboration.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
